message.content: Sunflowers, belonging to the genus Helianthus, do not possess any deadly toxins like many other plants. Therefore, they are considered safe and non-toxic for humans and animals alike. The seeds of sunflower are consumed by people as well as birds because of their nutritional value. However, it is always a good idea to practice caution while introducing new food items in one's diet since some individuals may be allergic to certain plant material or its pollen.
